revision.text:
{{BLP sources|date=April 2017}}{{Infobox comedian | name = Ray Ellin | medium = [[Stand up comedian]], [[actor]], [[writer]], [[Television producer|producer]], [[talk show host]] | nationality = [[United States|American]] | genre = [[Observational comedy]], [[Satire]]/[[Political satire]], [[Social commentary]] | subject = [[American culture]], [[American politics]], [[current events]], [[popular culture|pop culture]] | influences = [[David Letterman]], [[Johnny Carson]], [[Woody Allen]], [[Eddie Murphy]], [[Garry Shandling]], [[Martin Short]], [[Billy Crystal]], [[Jay Leno]], [[Sir Nicholas Winton]] | website = [http://www.rayellin.com/ rayellin.com] }}
'''Ray Ellin''' is an American [[comedian]], [[talk show host]], [[television producer|producer]], [[writer]], and [[Film director|director]].
==Career== Ellin performs at top comedy clubs around the United States. He hosted and wrote for the syndicated shows ''The Movie Loft'', ''[[Premium TV]],'' ''New York Now'', and ''BrainFuel TV''. He also hosts the ground-breaking web-based talk show ''LateNet with Ray Ellin''. The show has had appearances by comedians, actors, and authors including [[Chevy Chase]], [[Leonard Nimoy]], [[Jeff Garlin]], [[Hank Azaria]], [[Charles Grodin]], [[Richard Belzer]], [[Susie Essman]], [[Artie Lange]], [[Amy Sedaris]], [[Richard Kind]], [[Paul Shaffer]], [[Oksana Baiul]] and [[Fran Drescher]].
Ellin produced and directed the film ''The Latin Legends Of Comedy'',<ref>{{cite news|url=https://movies.nytimes.com/2006/09/29/movies/29lege.html?partner=rssnyt&emc=rss|title=On Stage and Off With Three Veterans of the Comedy Scene|last=Genzlinger|first=Neil|date=September 29, 2006|work=[[The New York Times]]|accessdate=2009-01-31}}</ref> which he financed on his own six credit cards.<ref name="Punchline">Dylan P. Gadino, [http://punchlinemagazine.com/site/ray-ellin-on-the-go/ "Ray Ellin: On the Go!"] ''Punchline'', May 10, 2006</ref> Its opening weekend, the film finished third in per-screen average behind [[Academy Awards|Oscar]] winners ''[[The Last King of Scotland (film)|The Last King Of Scotland]]'' and [[The Queen (2006 film)|''The Queen'']].{{Citation needed|date=January 2009}} The movie was acquired by [[20th Century Fox]] for US [[DVD]] rights.{{Citation needed|date=January 2009}} Ellin co-starred in the film ''Killing Cinderella'' opposite [[Jessica Capshaw]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.csmonitor.com/2002/0830/p18s01-almp.html|title='Is this thing on?' Today's comics find success elusive|date=August 30, 2002|work=[[The Christian Science Monitor]]|accessdate=2009-01-31}}</ref> In 2011, Ellin became the host of the ''Gong Show Live'', a resurrection of the iconic [[The Gong Show|television show]]. In 2012, he became the host of the new television show ''Worth The Wait''.
In 2013, Ellin opened Aruba Ray's Comedy Club on the island of Aruba. The venue recently celebrated its five-year anniversary, and does approximately 100 shows a year, and features top US comedians on each show (including Ellin). The wildly successful venue is rated number one on TripAdvisor in three different categories, including Best Show, Best Nightlife, and Best Fun and Games. Ellin has become an outspoken ambassador of Aruba, and once declared on an interview on Fox television that "Aruba saved him spiritually."
In 2018, Ellin became executive producer of the television show ''This Week at the Cellar.'' The show is scheduled to begin airing in October 2018 on Comedy Central.
==Personal==
Ellin grew up with nine older sisters, who had him listening to [[Barry Manilow]] songs as a small boy. Therefore, he knows the lyrics to almost all of Manilow's songs. At age eleven, would get up at 5:30 a.m. to deliver ''[[The Boston Globe]]''. Ellin moved to [[New York City]] after college. He moved around many times, at one point sleeping in the front seat of his [[Dodge Aspen]].<ref name="Clown">Steve Lipman, [https://www.thejewishweek.com/features/class_clown_eyes_a_list_0 "A Class Clown Eyes The A-List"], ''[[The Jewish Week]]'', September 30, 2009.</ref> While parked in front of a [[Manhattan]] high school, Ellin was awoken by students rocking the car. He has had a variety of jobs, including selling postal uniforms to letter carriers.<ref name="Punchline" /> Ellin has joked "You've never lived until you've measured the inseam of an angry mailman."
Ellin has been featured regularly in the "Page 6" column of the ''[[New York Post]]''<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://pagesix.com/2009/04/07/comic-overload/|title=COMIC OVERLOAD|last=Staff|first=PageSix com|date=2009-04-07|website=Page Six|access-date=2017-04-11}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://pagesix.com/2009/09/10/comic-confusion/|title=Comic confusion|last=Staff|first=PageSix com|date=2009-09-10|website=Page Six|access-date=2017-04-11}}</ref> and other media outlets.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/gossip/side-dish-chace-crawford-out-chugged-chicks-article-1.336385|title=Side Dish: Chace Crawford out-chugged by chicks|work=NY Daily News|access-date=2017-04-11|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/200002/all-the-wrong-moves-tom-cruise-admits-suffering-concussion|title=All the Wrong Moves: Tom Cruise Admits Suffering Concussion|work=E! Online|access-date=2017-04-11|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/gossip/celebrity-side-dish-article-1.322078|title=Celebrity Side Dish|work=NY Daily News|access-date=2017-04-11|language=en}}</ref> He has been linked to various actresses and newscasters, but his longest relationship was with a nurse. Ellin is rumored to have been linked with actress [[Sara Ramirez]], [[Olympic Games|Olympic]] Gold Medalist [[Oksana Baiul]], actress [[Kate Bosworth]], newscaster Shiba Russell, and actress [[Fran Drescher]]. He has denied all but Ramirez, who he says he "dated briefly." The others he has said are "lovely people, who I've met briefly or spoken with, that's all."
Ellin has helped raise over a million dollars for various charities; he has been quoted as saying "I want to make a fortune doing what I love to do, and then just be a philanthropist."
==Awards== * 2009: Ellin was named one of "New York's Best Emerging Artists". * 2006: Ellin received a Proclamation from the City of New York for his contributions to comedy. * His film ''The Latin Legends Of Comedy'' won the jury award at the [[Boston International Film Festival]].{{When|date=April 2017}}
==External links== *[http://www.rayellin.com Official Website] *{{IMDb name|0254123|Ray Ellin}}
